website_summaries.verdict: A tap and drill set that will help you save time and won't break your budget.
pros: Drills and taps in a single pass, so you can save both labor and time
Suitable for tapping on wood, planks, aluminum plates and sheet iron
Can be used on multi-spindle heads with reversing mechanisms
Metric sizes engraved on the bits for added convenience
cons: Bits consist of low-quality steel and are very brittle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to break in aluminum
customer_reviews.text: I had both the M5 and M3 taps break in aluminum when attempting to tap by hand. They worked fine for plastic, but I'm going to stick to better brands for work in aluminum. I've used both conventional and spiral flute taps before from Dormer, Morse, etc in aluminum and haven't broken any of those taps, so I at least sort of know what I'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Venzon

customer_reviews.title: Great for 3D-printed parts
customer_reviews.text: These bits are life-changing. I'd just been using normal drill bits and taps. This saves time and makes threaded holes of the same quality. Oh, and they're hex-shank, so you can use them in an electric screwdriver. One thing you should realize, though: If you're going to use these for drilling holes that don't necessarily need threads, you're going to annoy yourself pretty quick. You have to reverse the drill and back out of every hole.
customer_reviews.author: hi there

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of taps. Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This set of taps worked great. I liked that they drilled the hole, and tapped it at the same time. All of the tapping was done on aluminium, and they made perfect threads every time. Take your time when using the bits. Use plenty of oil, and take it slow. I had no problems with the set so far. Not a single one has broken yet. I really like them alot.
customer_reviews.author: Eninja67

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used 2 bits and the m6 worked great but the m2 flew into 4 parts and I was lucky enough that it was backing out when it came apart and I was able to salvage the piece I was trying to tap. It was my fault for not using enough cutting oil as I drilled. They are not bad for what they cost and buying another set to finish is still worth the time and money considering the cost of tap sets and numbered drill sets. I will buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk van Straaten

customer_reviews.title: Interesting concept the jury is still out..
customer_reviews.text: With a press drill these I can see being perfect. In a hand drill they can be tricky to use on hard AND soft material. On hard it hard to get it to bit so you will want to use a smaller drill to drill a pilot hole. On soft if you slip a little you can screw up the alignment and then the tap part won't be so useful. Trick is to go slow and have a good pilot hole no matter what.
customer_reviews.author: CharlesG

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bits, well made!!!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this to tap and thread some thin steel for a DIY project and they worked beautifully. Since then, I have used the to start tap, simply drill, and even tap into wood with no problem. I would recommend going slow on the drill if trying these in wood as they cut so easily, it is easy to get aggressive and chew up the threads in the substrate. The shank and threads are just as sharp and clean as the first day I got them and I have used over a dozen times. Great and highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: LEWS THERIN

customer_reviews.title: Works good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Worked really good. But slow on the threads, may want to do those by hand. I was doing some 1/8 inch steel and snapped it off half way through the threads, maybe I tilted sideways?
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: They stood behind their product
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have the best results with the quality of the first order I received. However, the company stood behind their product and promptly replaced item so I could finish my project. Therefore, I can say I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: lunger

customer_reviews.title: Poor product
customer_reviews.text: I was tapping some 3/16 inch steel and broke the first bit, used the next size up and broke it also. I thought it would be a good idea and faster but taps should not be ran on a drill But
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Works well, Makes clean threads
customer_reviews.text: Used this to drill/tap structural steel AFTER making a pilot hole. First couple holes went great, I did snap the bit, but I was on the high torque setting, will be sure to fix that next time. The threads were very smooth, great time saver.
customer_reviews.author: gary jay

customer_reviews.title: Re-tapped a derailleur b-screw hole perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to retap a stripped b-screw hole on a bicycle rear derailleur (a SRAM NX). The existing hole was M4; I increased the size to M5. It worked perfectly. I'd never tapped anything before, but I had no problem. I used a cordless power drill and plenty of Tap Magic, and I ran the drill on the slowest speed possible. I'm very happy; this saved me from having to buy a new $80 derailleur.
customer_reviews.author: Father of Five

customer_reviews.title: Won't hold up with mild steel use.
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what these are made of but it is brittle. Tapped one 1/4" hole then the next one it broke from fatigue, Even using cutting oil, will buy a real steel tap set. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Dom. H

customer_reviews.title: Be aware
customer_reviews.text: I should have read more the product more closely. I would not recommend using these combo drill/taps in steel thicker than 2/4" steel, and use a drill driver with an adjustable clutch on a low setting. I tried drilling/tapping 1/2" steel bar, and broke one when tapping, and one when trying to back out of the tapped & chamfered hole.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These things work great for doing quick tapping with a cordless drill
customer_reviews.text: I have used these bits several times since I bought them and they save a huge amount of time compared to getting out your conventional tap set and getting the darn thing started. I've done up to 1/2" thick M8 aluminum threads with no issues and the flutes still look great with no chips in them. Make sure to keep it nice and straight and to use a good cutting fluid; I use a little bottle of Tap Magic and it does a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz Hubert

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for a Polaris Slingshot Owner
customer_reviews.text: These are worth their weight in gold. Constantly modifying my Polaris Slingshot I find many a bolt cross threaded from the factory or just crude threads that shouldn't be. A quick run of this through each removed bolt makes them mate like butter. Be careful not to bottom out the bit, it will snap!
customer_reviews.author: J Van Son

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed at all.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this set tap some M3 sized threads. Unfortunately the M3 tap is WAY to big and my M3 screws just fall out now. Wasted time and money
customer_reviews.author: Chris1683

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Broke half way through the first hole and I was only chasing a thread that was factory tapped and then painted for shipping. Junk. I had bought both SAE and Metric.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Beltz

customer_reviews.title: neat tool, cuts tapping time 75% on multiple taps. Works best with light impact tool.
customer_reviews.text: Used for making tapped holes for mounting electronics on 1/4" wall square tubbing. This is cold rolled welded material that kills straight cut taps after 25-30 holes, these drill/tap/chamfer tools usually make it past 200 (unless I hit a weld).
customer_reviews.author: vitina

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the price fool you.  These are GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!! I was waiting for the Dewalt set to drop in price, but figured I'd give these a chance since they were so cheap. They worked GREAT!!! I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R Porter

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, until a thief stole them
customer_reviews.text: These worked great the one time I got to use them. Then they were stolen. But I'm sure if I'd have got to keep them, they would still be working as.well as they first did.
customer_reviews.author: George McFall

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal !!!
customer_reviews.text: The relation Price / Quality is Amazing !!! The set work very well and came very fast . I have only used the M4. Don't forgot to use the specific oil
customer_reviews.author: Gabriele Scorza

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for aluminum extrusion
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have said, these are perfect for 80/20 and other aluminum extrusion profiles. Tapping extrusion usually takes me an hour by hand for tables/other basic projects, but these bits turn that into a 10 minute ordeal. I use Tap Magic before each use and they show no signs of wear so far.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: It worked
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these bits to drill into a stainless railing. First one snapped immediately. I predrilled the rest of the holes before using this bit and it worked fine. It held up good enough to get the job done
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for flawless quick taps!
customer_reviews.text: Works great with 1/4 hex impact driver, can use with use a drill press or handheld one with a slip clutch, but as the torque will cause a twist with your hand and break the hardened bit if you aren’t careful
customer_reviews.author: Jason D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very clever and convenient product. Eliminates the possibility of using the wrong size pilot drill. Worked just fine, and appears to be of high quality. Will buy these again if I my set gets lost.
customer_reviews.author: Stainless

customer_reviews.title: Worked really good
customer_reviews.text: Never used a dual drill and tap before, but with an electric drill it was done so fast, just don't go too fast, it's quick. Went through a steel and aluminum stack of metal.
customer_reviews.author: C.M.V.B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quaity mulitple broken bits wehn used on Aluminum
customer_reviews.text: Putting a few small holes in Aluminum 1/4". I started with 3mm it snapped off. Changed to 4mm it also snapped off. I wouldn't trust these bits.
customer_reviews.author: no one

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I build rc pulling sleds and have to drill/tap allot of holes. I've tried different drill taps but they tend to not live long... so far I havent dulled or broken one of these
customer_reviews.author: jefff shirley

customer_reviews.title: Great taps, well worth it
customer_reviews.text: These are a great well cutting set of taps, I’ve used the same 6 mm tap in cast steel for 10 taps and the tap hasn’t yet dulled, cuts a perfect threaded, clean hole
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: So far these seem like well made bits. I bought this set to drill and tap aluminum extrusions. I have only used the M5 tap but many many times. It is still sharp and cuts very well. I always use aluminum cutting fluid and never let the bit get too hot. With proper use and maintenance I can see this set lasting a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: So small they were hard to torque - didBy work for me and I’ve retreaded a lot over the years
customer_reviews.author: Dav Mag

customer_reviews.title: These worked fine for me.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for a job. I had to do a bunch of repetitive operations and these really helped speed things along. I hate changing tools every few minutes just to a simple job.
customer_reviews.author: David Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: Thought these would be useful for several things, especially threading wood. They're ok. Not great.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Miller

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for....
customer_reviews.text: Was able to drill about 10 holes with the 3/8" bit before it snapped off. Was only tapping some 14ga mild steel....
customer_reviews.author: Ben B.

customer_reviews.title: At just 4 holes, you’d do better with Harbor Freight
customer_reviews.text: Just 5th hole into tapping pre-existing 6.8mm holes in 6105-T6 Aluminum extrusion with plenty of fluid it snapped flush to the material, ruining the piece.
customer_reviews.author: Slartibartfast

customer_reviews.title: Not for steel. Soft aluminum is probably the most they can handle.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine in plastic and aluminum. Snapped the first time I used it in steel.
customer_reviews.author: jj_0

customer_reviews.title: Broke easily
customer_reviews.text: Quick and simple... Broke it on the third hole and I was only twisting it by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Keegan

customer_reviews.title: Great drill tap combo. Never tried one b4,,worked amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fantastic. I never used one of these b4,but had to drill and tap small holes in very tight spaces,,this tool made it easy..
customer_reviews.author: vito tamarazzo

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but took a chance on the sae Set. I put 16 1/4" x 20 holes in 1/4" aluminum and the worked well. I did find Some aluminum getting stuck in tap section. Overall I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jesus
customer_reviews.text: 3/8 inch broke on its 3rd hole, was tapping 1/4 inch mild steal
customer_reviews.author: EDWARD P SEGAR

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service
customer_reviews.text: They work great!! I am always working on small projects at home a much have for your tool box. There customer service is top notch out standing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will buy different brand.
customer_reviews.text: While drilling this product bent and wiggles a lot which make it clumsy, not happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie Pigao

customer_reviews.title: Worked for almost a minute
customer_reviews.text: Tried to tap something. Went carefully and slowly. Snapped very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: gromit

customer_reviews.title: These are trash
customer_reviews.text: On my very first attempt at tapping a hole in aluminum, the 5/32 bit broke., leaving me now, with a piece of bit I have to figure out how to get out. Complete and utter trash. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly high quality, these bits are what made me try other Migiwata products....
customer_reviews.text: These are surprisingly good quality combination drill-tap bits. These are at least on-par, if not superior to DeWalt's line - and for a little more than the cost of 1 DeWalt bit you get a set... And if you keep little lube on these bits when using them they'll last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rhys

customer_reviews.title: Get Lubrication
customer_reviews.text: I broke the 3/4", so I purchased another set and was extra diligent to use the lubricating oil. No issues after that.
customer_reviews.author: iPad3userinMA

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with with my first experience with these bits
customer_reviews.author: Derek Soucy

customer_reviews.title: In the first use it broke
customer_reviews.text: In the first use it broke, I hope my money back
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Fabricio Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product kept me from using wrong drill for tap, also made tapping easy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bits!
customer_reviews.text: These are super sturdy and work. Fast shipping and reliable seller!
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: good set
customer_reviews.text: It is a very good selection of bits but a quality is a little weak. I broke most used M8 bit without forcing much.
customer_reviews.author: zauver

customer_reviews.title: Brittle, be careful.
customer_reviews.text: It can't stand any kind of horizontal stress under heat. Don't bother with steel. Very brittle.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Bruner

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and durable
customer_reviews.text: Have been working with them for 4 months and they're rock solid so far. Been tap-drilling on both steel and aluminium and it's been perfect so far. Just gotta know what you're doing.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t use on thicker than 1/4” stock
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of combo drill and tap used it on 3/16” and thinner flat stock with great results
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: They work rather well at this time I have used 2 of them. Worked great
customer_reviews.author: Ed Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at discount price.
customer_reviews.text: I work at a automotive factory and use a drill and tap quite often. I bought these to decrease on time spent hand tapping. Used them today on 10, 1/4 inch steel brackets and the 5mm drill and tap worked amazingly. No problems at all. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of months of use the they wear out. So beware if your using once in while is fine but if your constally using them they won't work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Bits
customer_reviews.text: These bits are awesome. I bought them because it was a great combination of different sizes. The bits are very strong and I was able to drill tap the aluminum for my workbench project. I would definitely buy from this vendor again. She shipped everything immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bloom

customer_reviews.title: I build my rig and use this tap very well ...
customer_reviews.text: I build my rig and use this tap very well to build my 13 GPUs rig. and the seller is very thoughtful and kind. Thanks.

customer_reviews.title: Quality tap at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: This is item worked well and allowed me to repair a broken handle on a wine cooler refrigerator, which is good because I like wine.

customer_reviews.title: Broke at the first use!
customer_reviews.text: Not very good drills, but good seller! Stands for his products.

customer_reviews.title: complete waste
customer_reviews.text: used larger size (M8) to successfully tap 3 holes then it broke
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have only used once so far, but performed as expected

customer_reviews.title: They dont work as all in one
customer_reviews.text: I have tried tapping on 5 occasions and they just dont work, its is best to drill a hole first then use this as a tap only, it only works on thru holes
customer_reviews.author: Dale Bornemann

customer_reviews.title: Just go slow and easy when drilling and backing out of the hole
customer_reviews.text: My first tapping experience. I thought it was going to be difficult, but these bits made it simple. Just go slow and easy when drilling and backing out of the hole. Threads that were created are clean and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Broken at first use
customer_reviews.text: I use it to tap 3mm steel and use Milwaukee m12 fuel drill ,use gear 1,drill through a while and then tap thread and the bit broken ,I had use tap oil.
customer_reviews.author: ck law

customer_reviews.title: The bits worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I used these to drill/tap some aluminum stock for a few projects. Like any drills take care to not push to hard, especially with the smaller bits, or you risk breaking them. Remember, let the tools do the work!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really slick 2in1 tool that was very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Hawton

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Im an electrican they work just like the high dollar ones just cost less

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tried them yet but I'm sure they will be awesome

customer_reviews.title: It worked as promised
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product and was able to do the job I bought it for.

customer_reviews.title: 3mm snapped on first hole while being slow and careful.
customer_reviews.text: While being careful on my first hole the 3mm tap snapped half way through a 1/4" 5052 aluminum plate.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G.

customer_reviews.title: Very brittle!
customer_reviews.text: Just like my other review for their other set these things are brittle! Snapped right at the shank on first use. My DeWalt ones are holding up better than these!

customer_reviews.title: It worked good the one time I used it
customer_reviews.text: I only used one bit one time so I can't give a fair review. It worked good the one time I used it.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery, very generic packaging, and broke bit on first attempt. Its a good concept but quality lacking.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give zero stars. Don't waste your time. Cheap, broke on first tap in extruded aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

product_meta.title: Hymnorq HSS Metric Hex Shank High Speed Steel Spiral Flute 2-in-1 Combination Drill and Tap Bit Set M3-M10 with 1/4” Hex Shank Set of 6pcs
product_meta.description:
Style:Metric 6pcsOVERVIEW
Made from high-speed steel, these combination drill and tap bits are designed to tap up to 10-gauge wood, plastic and other soft materials. They are not suitable for drill and tap in metals. 
These drill taps are a great time saving accessory. Each one is a combination of a twist drill bit and a tap. The point is the same as a twist drill bit, which is self-centering. So, you don't have to buy a centering drill bit or a center punch. Now you can drill and tap at the same time in one operation. 
No tool changes, good alignment and fast cycle times make this a very productive tool. 
This Migiwata high-speed steel (HSS 4341) drill/tap combination bit set are offered in a set of 6 different metric sizes (M3, M4, M5, M6, M8 and M10).

TECHNICAL DETAILS
Material: High Speed Steel 4341
Tapping Material Type: Wood, Plastic, etc.
Tapping Material Thickness: About 5mm
Point Type: 135 Degree Split Point
Shank: 6.35mm (1/4”) Quick Change Hex

NOTICE:
It’s highly recommended that the combination drill and tap bit is used on a tapping machine with drill lubricant. 
If you apply an electric hand drilling machine to do the tapping job, please pay attention to your operating, because excessive shaking and tilting may affect the result and even break the bit.

CAUTION: 
Any cutting tool may break or shatter under improper use. Government regulations require use of safety glasses and other appropriate safety equipment at all times in the vicinity of use.
feature_bullets: 6 sizes in one drill and tap bit set (M3 x 0.5, M4 x 0.7, M5 x 0.8, M6 x 1, M8 x 1.25, M10 x 1.5) to meet your diversified requirements;

Quick change 1/4” (6.35mm) hex shank with metric sizes engraved on the bits. Wide spiral flutes carry the chips out of the hole. Can be used on multi-spindle heads with reversing mechanisms for tapping in most materials.
Drills and taps in a single pass to save your labor and precious time. No tool changes, good alignment and fast cycle times make this a very productive tool.

Made of high quality HSS 4341; Suitable for tapping on wood, plank, plastic etc. Work VERY slowly and carefully with these bits when drilling metal. If your main purpose is to drill and tap in metal, please buy our titanium coated HSS 6542 drill tap bit set.
Each size of the bit set can be purchased separately in a 5pc pack in our store.
